meanings.definition: To behave in a cowardly or weak manner.
meanings.sent1: During the scary movie, he wimped out and hid behind the couch.
meanings.sent2: She wimped when faced with the spider in the bathroom.
meanings.sent3: The little dog wimped away from the big, friendly cat.
meanings.sent4: His confidence wimped like a deflating balloon in front of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's courage wimped at the sight of the enemy's numbers.

meanings.definition: To back out or give up on something due to fear or lack of courage.
meanings.sent1: He wimped out of the dare to jump off the high diving board.
meanings.sent2: She wimped from the challenge of speaking in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The cat wimped out of chasing the mouse when it squeaked loudly.
meanings.sent4: His determination wimped out like a candle in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's stamina wimped out before reaching the finish line.
